snippet: The chief executive of Saks Fifth Avenue’s parent company denied accusations made by a former employee that she was harassed, then dismissed, over her transgender identity.
abstract: Gerald L Storch, chief executive of Saks Fifth Avenue parent company Hudson Bay, denies accusations that former employee was harassed and subsequently dismissed over her transgender identity; Leyth O Jamal had filed suit contending that Saks managers had pressured her to act, dress and identify as a man, despite being aware of her identity.
lead_paragraph: The chief executive of Saks Fifth Avenue’s parent company denied accusations made by a former employee that she was harassed, then dismissed, over her transgender identity.

headline.main: Saks Owner Denies Bias Claim by a Transgender Former Employee
headline.print_headline: Saks Owner Denies Bias Claim by a Transgender Former Employee
